moves.1. e4:
I started this game because I was bored and wanted to play someone a couple days after joining the "Southern Chess". Why not play a teammate? I looked for someone near my rank, and voila! here we are. I'm actually annotating this on my 22nd move.

Ah, my standard opening.
moves.1... c5: I'm seeing this more and more nowadays...
moves.2. d4: This is the something Moria Gambit... I have no clue about official names, but I'm told he's to take the pawn... <_<
moves.2... e6:
Gambit... declined? 
FINE! Gambit sucked as an X-men anyway. :P
moves.3... Nf6 4. f3 Bd6 5. e5:
Drop it like it's hot (hot)
drop it like it's hot (hot)
And when a b--ch gets an- oh, sorry, I really don't have much to say about this schtuff.
I figured a favorable pin was in store since I was feeling a threat in the middle, so i figured that snatching a pawn or knight for a pawn was very good. Especially the bishop, since it wasn't protected.
moves.5... Nd5 6. exd6 Qa5+: Harsh, dude, harsh. Moving that queen all up in my turf, denying me that d6 pawn coverage from his buddy back two squares...
moves.7. c3 c4 8. Bd2 Qb6 9. b3: And I have to make the nessesary sacrifice...
moves.10... Nf6 11. Nf4: I forget my original reasoning for this move... I think it was to keep the queen off d5 because of my next move...
moves.11... e5: he's probably plotting to force my knight away and get himself a pair of pawns for one of his own. well, either that, or he wants me to blow a move moving my knight back to defend that pesky pawn there on d4
moves.12. c5: He can have the Knight. I wants me somma dat!
moves.12... Qc7: I honestly considered for a few minutes chasing the queen with my knight.
moves.13. Nd3: but, alas, it was not to be!
moves.14... O-O 15. Bg2 Nc6: Apparently, he doesn't see me lining up the knight in my sights with my bishop...
moves.16. f4 f6: And he gave me a free check, to boot.
moves.17. Bxd5+ Kh8: Does anyone else agree that having a king stuck in one square is a bad thing?
moves.18. fxe5 Re8: smart move. It locks off my pawn from causing further discord amoungst the Black Forces.
moves.19. Bf4: time to pump up the defense. You can do eet, little guy! Scare black into submission!
moves.19... b6: now if only he'd move his other knight <3
moves.20. O-O: to free up the pawn, y'see. I'm not a big fan of castle-ing (I cant spell >.<)
moves.20... Bb7: I didn't forsee his next move...
moves.21. Re1 Nxe5: giving up his knight for a pot-shot at my bishops and knight... GENIUS! :P
moves.22. dxe5: I accept his attack on my bishop humbly. I was out manuvered this day... BUT I SHALL WIN THIS WAR!!
moves.22... Bxd5 23. exf6:
What happen?
Somebody set us up the bomb!
moves.24... Qxf6: I shall avenge you, loyal pawn!!
moves.26. Nf7+:
All your Base are belong to us!
The following is the Checkmating sequence. It would've been a bit closer if he took the knight on f7 instead of moving.  I would've gotten a Queen, but he would've gotten a Knight and Rook, so it would've been pretty awesome, no?
moves.26... Kg8 27. Nxd8+: This Game is pretty much over. See? I was right that the whole not giving the King an escape hatch was a bad idea... not enough mobility for the king. It allows me to force out a series of moves leading to checkmate. looking back, Nf7 was his only chance to throw off the mating sequence, but would've thrown away his queen.
moves.27... Kf8 28. Bd6+:
Next moves were:
28. ...        Qxd6
29. Qxd6  Kg8
30. Rxe8#

Thanks for the Game, CW! It was fun! (Oh, And the Boss is/was telling me that my annotations were a little harsh to you and that I have an asswhooping coming my way via him. Message me if there's anything you want me to add/remove, m'kay?)
